title: Would rate lower if possible
text:

title: Worse App

I don‚Äôt need my real name to look at Market place, especially if I‚Äôm just needing to shop and FB refuses to allow this UNLESS you have an account. Who himself took this idea as his own in the beginning and buying Instagram and WhatsApp so he would not have ANY competition. I look forward to the day someone has the guts to compete and shut down FB and their illegal practices for good!

title: Locked out
text: I am very unhappy with Facebook. The problem I have: I recently had my network compromised. This led to me to implement a number of security methods, update my devices, and sign out of devices. I also got my phone replaced (but kept the same number). I am unable to login because it is requiring my 2FA - however my old phone no longer has facebook‚Äôs metadata. I also logged out of my portal and iPad. This leaves me without a single previous device browser that has logged in and therefore I can‚Äôt approve my login from my new iPhone-x. I was then forced to send my license in order to regain access to my account. I have done this now three times in the 2 months I have not been able to access Facebook.  You have my license info, I have followed the form to get back access, and still no word. I attempted to call but you state you don‚Äôt take customer service calls. I have sent a DM to the Twitter account as well but still nothing... hoping this review pops to the top so someone might see it from Facebook and explain to me the voodoo I must do to get back access? DNA sample? Come on, get it together Facebook!

title: Decent social media but website is TERRIBLE
text: When it works, it‚Äôs really noce to be able to connect with people and see and share posts:) bit very disappointing when it doesn‚Äôt let you use it ever again and locks you out forever.:( Ok so I made an account on here and followed all and only the directions they gave me to set it up. When I finished, a random thing popped up and said that it saw ‚Äúsuspicious activity‚Äù from my account and made me send in a picture of myself to verify that it was really me. Then it said that my account would be disabled until they reviewed my submission. A month and a half later, it still says the same thing, so I tried making a new account. At first all was fine, but it did the same thing only five minutes after I completed the setup! I have no idea why it‚Äôs doing this. I did absolutely nothing wrong and the only reason I was making an account was so I could use Facebook marketplace. If anyone has any tips on how to fix this, please let me know!

title: What the heck
text:
So today Facebook decided it would block me from blocking ads.  I don‚Äôt want to see your ads, so I block them.  Then I get a message that says, ‚ÄúIt looks like you were misusing this feature by going too fast.  You‚Äôve been blocked from using it.‚Äù  I am not misusing anything.  I‚Äôm blocking the ridiculous amount of ads you suddenly put on my feed.  How dare you force advertisements upon me by not letting me block them.  That is absolutely ridiculous.  Every third post there‚Äôs an ad.  I don‚Äôt care about the trash you‚Äôre trying to force me to buy.  I don‚Äôt want to see it.  I didn‚Äôt have a problem before today.  I only ever saw my friend‚Äôs posts.  I have 2,700 pages blocked because I don‚Äôt want to see ads.  I use your service to connect with friends.  I am so disgusted by this.  What point is there in blocking me from hiding ads?  

Another problem I have is that the, ‚ÄúMost Recent‚Äù button is completely broken.  Every single post on the most recent feed is in exactly the same order as the regular feed.  That is not the most recent stuff.  I‚Äôm deleting this app.  I can‚Äôt even understand the foolery.

title: Idk what to title this
text: I have a lot to be grateful for with this platform. It‚Äôs allowed me to have my content all in one place and meet new people who turn into customers. The reason for 4 stars is that there seems to be a wide open door for hackers and no recourse for business owners who lose access to their very hard earned page and all the criteria/ monetization that goes along with it. It makes you feel vulnerable and even discouraged at times seeing peers goes through this time after time. It also makes sense to put less effort into a platform that operates that way and start thinking of how to not have all your eggs in one basket so to speak. And if you‚Äôre expanding across platforms, that means less time for this one. I would think fb would want to keep its creators here and make them feel secure. I sure hope this changes. I truly love what I‚Äôve been able to do thus far ü©µ

title: Facebook sometimes listens to my cell phone calls
text: A few times I have been talking to friends on my cell phone about a product a friend likes or I like. Minutes later I see ads for the same product. One time a friend said she would like one of those walk in bath tubs because she was afraid of falling. I hung up the phone and checked my Facebook wall only to find an ad for the walk in tubs AND for one of those "I've fallen and I can't get up" services. Facebook searches through my private address book and suggests that I might want to "friend" people they find. There is so much fake news that shows up on my wall. Some of the ads are so obviously fake and they show up everywhere on FB. Ones about alive celebrities where the ad says so and so died and no one knew she died. Others that say things like Joy Behr is quitting the View because she uses a certain face cream. Our president spends all his waking hours lying to the American public. I don't want to be bombarded with more lies. I wish I could trust Facebook. I like being in touch with friends of my choosing. I don't like being manipulated by Facebook. They are very invasive.

title: Facebook is a joke
text:
Facebook is one of the ways that I keep up with my family and friends. So I guess I won‚Äôt be deleting my account anytime soon.
My complaint is that not only myself, but a lot of my friends comments are flagged or they are put on restriction because of something they have said to someone else. They are responding to a comment someone has said to them Facebook takes everything out of context. I myself have been on restriction probably seven times in the last two years. for example, someone bullied me in response to a comment I made in a group and when I stood up for my foot self, Facebook put me on restriction where I could not post in groups or Start calls for 30 days. Yet Facebook did nothing to the person who bullied me. In addition, Facebook let‚Äôs half naked people asking for sex stay on Facebook and they are not reprimanded. What a crock of crap. Facebook protects the people who are in the wrong and the people who are in the right get punished. This is just not good business practice.

title: Facebook it‚Äôs not the same
text: I remember back in the day what a big thing Facebook was. Today all of that is over. It‚Äôs a shame of what used o be something awesome turns out to be what it is today.

title: Outdated and uninteresting
text: I just download Facebook to keep up with family. Right off the bat it wouldn‚Äôt let me set up an account and took me right to the recovery page even though I had never used my email or phone number to set up an account. I linked my contacts since my only goal was to stay in touch with family and almost none of the recommended people to follow were people I even know. After following some family and friends I only see about 10% of my feed being their posts or my interests while the rest is adds and marketing for other products or other meta platforms. I will probably delete my account because it‚Äôs just not worth it and Facebook feels like it has no place in my social media circle since it‚Äôs hard to connect with people I know when everything I see is an add. It was hard to set up and get an interesting feed and once I did I was disappointed by all the spam and paid marketing. I would suggest other apps like tiktok or even Twitter if you want to find and form a community based on interests or friends/family.

title: What‚Äôs wrong with Facebook

title: Harmful Artificial Intelligence

title: Necessary, but not fun anymore
text: Facebook is a critical social and info-sharing platform to which I‚Äôve been loyal since its launch. Throughout my own disability, and now through a global pandemic, it‚Äôs allowed me to remain connected in ways that wouldn‚Äôt have been accessible for me if I‚Äôd been experiencing disability before the 21st century. In those ways, FB has truly been a saving grace. However, the algorithms and review process now deployed to catch violence, threats, etc. have swung into dictatorial overcorrection. Recently, I received a temporary ban because I used language that was too colorful when describing that I don‚Äôt like playing winter sports. Yet I‚Äôve seen all sorts of bigotry, violence, misogyny, racism, ableism, etc. flourish all over other people‚Äôs posts and comments unchecked. But thank goodness that FB stopped me from using naughty words to say I don‚Äôt like playing in the snow! I keep using FB because I have to, but it has allowed itself to become a ridiculous, authoritarian company.

title: Doesn‚Äôt allow couples to share a page
text: my husband and I setup our Facebook account in 2008 I think ... for at least 4 years we were ‚ÄúCarrie and Marc‚Äù... then suddenly, our account was locked and we were sent an email stating we violated their policy and they had right to believe we were misrepresenting ourselves. We were told we had to send them our picture ID to reopen the account.  We did. Then they arbitrarily decided the account would be my husband‚Äôs name only and we have never been allowed to change that. Well, FB is big brother and apparently FB wants to keep a close eye on my husband.  Take a peak around FB - how many fake Trump accounts are there? How many fake celebrity accounts are there? How many people use fake names in general!!?! We were using our real names all along, but since my husband happens to work in ammo/weapons industry, he‚Äôs apparently of interest to them.  Keep watching FB - we are pretty boring!! Want to see my son‚Äôs football game? Oh or maybe my dinner last night? Or for some teal juicy stuff, maybe you can catch me sharing a church service ... whoa now that‚Äôs something to report!!

title: Junk App
text: Facebook updates regularly and adds or adjusts features but never seems to fix actual problems. Of course, Facebook is feedback-aversive. A new issue has popped up - when you share a post and select ‚ÄúWrite‚Äù so you can add notes, the predictive text doesn‚Äôt work properly. If you‚Äôre typing and then click on the completed word and hit space afterward, it actually backspaces and erases the last letter of the word that was just put there. If you don‚Äôt catch it and retype the last letter and hit space and start typing the next word, you end up with one long word instead of two. This is is s new glitch that Facebook hasn‚Äôt bothered to fix in its many updates since the glitch started. Also now when I open the app, I have maybe two or three posts and it will not scroll down any further. I guess Mark Zuckerburg is too busy helping Trump and fascism to really give a rat‚Äôs behind about what‚Äôs going on with the app. (You can catch a thirty day ban if you insult a snowflake Republican, but by all means start a white nationalist page that openly promotes sedition because that‚Äôs okay according to Facebook.)

title: Hackers Haven
text: So many family members have been hacked and Facebook does NOTHING about it. My daughter had her page for over 10 years and had so many pictures on there that she didn‚Äôt have anymore on her phone when her phone crashed and thought she was safe having the security features set up. She was wrong. She was hacked, Facebook told her to send her ID in to get verified and all that did was give the hacker proof of my daughters identity. That hacker went and sent that ID to everyone, claiming to be her, trying to scam so many more people. When she made a new page and messaged her old one to give her page back, they told her to give them her SS number and then they would release it. She didn‚Äôt fall for it at all.  She was never able to get her old page back and Facebook was ZERO HELP. It‚Äôs still floating around causing problems. She even had some angry girlfriends threatening her because they thought she was hitting on their boyfriends. Disgusting that Meta doesn‚Äôt have a phone number to call to get these hackers taken away from their hacked pages. Not impressed at all.

title: Wrongfully banned on Marketplace
text: Sooo I have sold on FB Marketplace for sometime. Was probably one of my favorite sites to sell. About a year ago I had a customer send a message about when I would be mailing her package. At the time I was a first responder and very busy but on the day of the message her package was placed in the mail. So when I messaged to notify the client she stated she had reported me because ‚ÄúI took to long to respond‚Äù. Upon trying to get on my account I was banned! I kept in contact with my client and I have all the messages stating she received her package and was delighted with the shoes. I never got paid and to this day my account is still banned. I appealed as many times as I could with no success and no reason as to why. You can‚Äôt talk to a human at all. I am so highly disappointed in the customer service of FB marketplace. I couldn‚Äôt even tell you how long the ban is for. So to everyone that sells on Marketplace you should know that any customer can say anything about you and FBs algorithm will give you the BAN and keep you money with absolutely no explanation and no assistance..

title: A Chronic Downfall for Facebook?
text:
I have been a user of this social media app for a few years now, and it has been nothing but a disappointment. The algorithm seems to prioritize content that is either irrelevant or just plain boring, and it's become increasingly difficult to find posts from friends and family members. The app constantly bombards me with irrelevant ads and sponsored content, making it almost impossible to enjoy my time on the platform.

The user interface is clunky and outdated, and the app often crashes or freezes while I'm using it. The privacy settings are confusing and difficult to navigate, making it difficult to keep my personal information secure. And to make matters worse, the app seems to be overrun by trolls and fake accounts, making it difficult to have meaningful conversations or interactions with others.

Overall, I would not recommend this social media app to anyone. It's a frustrating and unenjoyable experience, and there are much better options out there for staying connected with friends and family.

title: Never A Good Update Ever
text: Genuinely a clunky social service to use, I stopped using it years ago but in light of meta lobbying to ban a more favorable app, I‚Äôve decided to give my word as to why this I left years ago. Not only is it a breeding ground for people filled with hate, the app itself is slow and buggy as all get out. I understand that older apps need time, but when you consistently update it, I‚Äôd expect it to work faster, not slower! I‚Äôm currently only using this app via messenger to connect with my dying grandma. That‚Äôs it. None of my friends are on here, nor are any of my family, minus the above said dying grandma. If this app had any hope of surviving, it‚Äôs devs would look at trends with the younger generations, like how it did long ago, and not shove its heels into sinking sand and say ‚Äúthis app is good!‚Äù What‚Äôs worse is that Instagram is falling the same fate of Facebook. (I wonder why‚Ä¶.) but in all seriousness the last good update was when the like button became all those reactions, because after that the website became too much of a hassle to even load properly on my computer.

title: My account got compromised and Facebook is doing nothing to resolve it
text:
My account recently got compromised. Even though I had two-factor auth enabled, someone was able to disassociate my phone number from my account, change my email and change my password. I have exhausted all of Facebook‚Äôs public documentation and instructions on how to secure an account and none of it is working. I am still unable to access my account. My business is associated with the account, and so I am also unable to access my business page. I even created a new account so I could report the old one, but Facebook found nothing wrong with it. I have over 15 years of data on that account and Facebook is doing NOTHING to help me get me back into my account.

Edit: it got worse. I created a new account since, weeks later, I still didn‚Äôt gain access to my old account. A friend reported my new account as suspicious and it got permanently disabled. Honestly I‚Äôve been meaning to quit Facebook for years, so minus the fact that they have a death grip on 15 years of my data, it‚Äôs for the best.

title: Trash
text: I used to really enjoy Facebook until these past two years. Everything is so pick me like. Facebook allows CERTAIN individuals the ability to curse or insult or disrespect other people. wether that be religion, sex, orientation or identity. title: Censorship issue for years that ppl are too lazy to fix
text:
Facebook has known for a long time that the system set up to take down and censor posts is broken. Extremely broken and now is even worse because of Covid it appears based off of what I‚Äôve seen when it comes to reporting posts that there are no real people reviewing posts getting taken down it‚Äôs just a systematic robot that filters key words and phrases.

I‚Äôve have had people tell me extremely vulgar and hateful comments and they will not get taken down but because I have referenced what they said to go against their vulgar and hateful comments and been put in Facebook jail for it. Even if I report their comments I‚Äôve only had one occasion where a got a comment taken down. 

Facebook knows this is a problem and has not changed it despite it effecting people who want to interact to others using the app but have to work around these random rules that are put in the censorship system because all they are effective at is eliminating posts and comments and not the problem itself.

title: Wrongfully wiped my profile page clean and no way to contact them.
text:
I am an artist and have two facebook business pages I am now unable to administer or manage because FB completely shut down my profile page (which they were both linked to) and wiped it off their media.  I complied with their request for my ID to confirm my age in December (I‚Äôm over their age requirement); and, they still did not reinstate me, but made my page unavailable.  They requested I contact them if I wanted to inquire but that‚Äôs kind of hard to do when THERE IS NO WAY TO CONTACT FACEBOOK TO INQUIRE!  

I had close to 5,000 friends and followers.    Years of building my profile and pages.   A client texted me and said that my profile dropped off their friends list when FB destroyed my profile.  They thought I had unfriended them!

I created a new profile page only to reach out to a few; however, I will not put the effort into building back what was lost.  And btw, I discourage everyone I know from getting involved with such a corrupt, uncaring organization.  ESPECIALLY if they have a business.

title: Rating from a 12-year Facebook user
text:
My review will probably be deleted because that‚Äôs what Facebook does. I got Facebook as a way to stay connected with distant family, friends, and a way to market my small business. However all I see now is true propaganda. I see ads that Black Lives Matter and I can donate. I see ‚Äúfact checks‚Äù breaking down anything positive that has to do with President Trump. I see post after post deleted because they aren‚Äôt allowed to convey the free speech of a certain group of people. This IS happening, and happens on Snapchat news feeds as well, not surprisingly an affiliate of Facebook. I never thought I would see a decline in American freedom as I am experiencing first hand through the Facebook app, right here on my smart phone. Oh yeah, and better make sure you turn off all of the extra, unnecessary information tracking settings like off-Facebook activity logs, because Facebook gets all of that from you, likely whether you leave it on or turn it ‚Äúoff‚Äù. 

The Facebook app is 5/5 a platform for what‚Äôs going wrong with America.

title: Char Broil grills
text: I am sending this with one star rating because it won‚Äôt let me send zero star rating. A $450 Grill I ordered arrived at my home today.  I am 74 and have health issues which makes me high risk for corona virus. Since I could not buy it at a store because of the virus for the first time I bought directly from Char Broil‚Äôs web page. I was shocked to return from a doctor‚Äôs visit  to find a 140 pound box dumped in the middle of my driveway blocking the steps to my deck and side door.  I called Char Broil and explained why I needed to return the grill. I thought it would be partially assembled. They refused to take it back because I should have known how it would be packaged. They did not care about any health concerns I had about shopping in a store and were not responsible for how Fed Ex delivered it. They said it was my responsibility to find someone to move it to my deck and put it together. For the past 20 years I have had nothing but Char Broil Grills at my home but I always bought them from Walmart‚Äôs  or Lowe‚Äôs with a return policy.  I have learned a hard lesson.  If you buy a Char Broil Grill DO NOT BUY IT DIRECTLY FROM CHAR BROIL but buy it from a vendor.

title: Facebroke
text: It‚Äôs obvious the developers don‚Äôt read the reviews here. Otherwise, they‚Äôd actually address the problems. People are only able to see a few posts before they can‚Äôt scroll any further. Weeks old posts are labeled as recent. Comments on posts either don‚Äôt appear, or you have to keep clicking ‚Äúmost relevant‚Äù then ‚Äúall posts‚Äù to get them to appear. The flagging algorithm is a total mess. Anyone can be accused of ‚Äúhate speech‚Äù and will be punished for it, even when nothing remotely resembling hate speech was said. Meanwhile, someone can make one racist comment after another, get reported, and nothing happens to them. Pictures showing no nudity or sexual content get flagged for ‚Äúviolating community standards‚Äù while pictures actually containing nudity, are allowed to stay. Typing is becoming nearly impossible. The space button either doesn‚Äôt work, inserts ‚Äú.‚Äù, or completely changes the typed words into gibberish. Using predictive texting results in more gibberish. I could go on and on. Fix your app/website, before you end up going the way of Tom, and his Space. Because that‚Äôs where you‚Äôre headed.

title: Modern day Facebook
text: What a disappointment Facebook has become in the last 5+ years with its overbearing leftist leaning Community Standards and policies. You can‚Äôt even make a joke or post anything with satire anymore without some fact-checker or thin-skinned employee getting all bent out of shape over it. We used to be able to express our thoughts and feelings however we wanted, as long there was no real threat of actual violence. These days you can‚Äôt even say the F word without getting a 30 day ban! You know it‚Äôs bad when they ban you for a post you made 6 months ago out of the blue that you copied and pasted from another user, along with thousands of other people! Long story short, Facebook has become a running joke of all the social media platforms amongst a majority of its users and my circle. Makes you wonder who they‚Äôre really working and suppressing information for. I‚Äôm pretty sure most of the world already knows the answer to the, but I‚Äôll leave this here for educational purposes only. :)

title: Worst social media app ever
text: facebook is the worst most sketchy app ever.  I was interested in using Facebook market to find some furniture. All i wanted to do was log back in to an old account of mine but i had forgotten the password. So I went through the steps of changing my password and then Facebook comes up with this message saying ‚Äúunusual activity‚Äù on my account and wants to send codes to random people from my old account and have me call them and get the codes from them....‚Äùfor verification! ‚Äú WHAT!??? So then it gives you another option to verify yourself so I click on that for a different option......now they want me to send in a picture of my GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID and they‚Äôll review it in 30 days!!! FOR A SOCIAL MEDIA APP??? Ummmm no. This is one of the main reasons I stayed away from Facebook for years because they don‚Äôt respect privacy and its just a bogus app all together. I‚Äôll stick to other apps cause facebook is sketchy and ridiculous!

title: Love Facebook, buuuuuuuut‚Ä¶
text:
As much as I truly love Facebook, there are some serious issues with customer service or banning people for having a sense of humor that is entirely appropriate, and in context, greatly appreciated.

Also, I recently attempted to boost an ad on Facebook for a mom and pop bookstore where I work on Sundays. 

This was an incredible mistake, as Facebook chose to dribble out the payments piecemeal instead of withdrawing the full amount that I had agreed to. 

My bank froze my checking account because they thought I was encountering suspicious activity.

I will never again boost another post on Facebook. I will also never make another donation on Facebook as I am in no mood to offer them my new debit or credit card information. 

Again, Facebook is an incredible amount of fun, and I love spending my time here but there‚Äôs no quick way to get a solution or an answer from someone concerning basic things like advertising or why was my innocent post misinterpreted.

At the same time, there are continuous and ever present advertisements for pornography and idiotic products that have no bearing on the Facebook group that I created. 

I don‚Äôt expect anything to change, but I thought it worth my time to at least put this in writing. I wonder if anyone will ever read it.

title: Extremely upset
text: Facebook took it upon themselves to lock me out of my account. I‚Äôve tried taking to someone and they told me someone had tried to buy something through Facebook using my information. I had to very who I was and all sorts of other stuff. I got cut off while taking to them. I got mad and deactivated my Facebook account. They were hung up on the fact that my account had tried to get accessed from an unknown source. Anyway bottom line is I sometimes use my iPad and I also use my iPhone depending on where I am. I reactivated my account several days later and I can use my iPad but Facebook has my phone locked still and won‚Äôt allow me to use Facebook through my phone. It truly makes me angry. It‚Äôs my information and it‚Äôs my phone. It doesn‚Äôt belong to Facebook. I make the payment each month to use my phone, Facebook doesn‚Äôt. So yes I‚Äôm extremely angry. I‚Äôm not a child and I don‚Äôt like being treated like one especially from some idiot that Facebook has hired to scan people‚Äôs Facebook accounts and they make the decision to lock a person out.

title: Someone please make a new FB-like platform cause this ain‚Äôt it. SMH.
text: I‚Äôve had the same account since 2009 and after going back and forth about them suspending my account from something I posted 3 years ago, they continue to play their games. First off, it wasn‚Äôt anything close to being bad or inappropriate. Secondly, when I appealed it (again) they claimed it was a mistake on their technology and then they restored my content and opened my account. A WHOLE DAY later, they suspended it AGAIN for the SAME THING! Trust me when I say that I‚Äôm really starting to hate Facebook but I just want my pictures back. Most of it is stored on there. Also, I reported people posting pornography links and pics and they say that it‚Äôs okay and that it‚Äôs up to their standards! What?!?! So Facebook has a bunch of perverted people on staff and are okay with that type of content but not a post about me loving my children?!???? MAKE IT MAKE SENSE! As soon as I get my account back, I‚Äôm downloading my pics then deleting it for good and hopefully someone else starts a platform that can do a better job than this.

title: Facebook fail or the app?
text: Well they are both BAD. I have been hacked, warned, account suspended or whatever they call it. I‚Äôve been warned for bullying when I was exposing some woman peddling dogs for sale on different areas like a weather station account etc. I‚Äôve been threatened, harassed, called filthy names and much more. Facebook has done NOTHING every single time. The app is ludicrous to use. All ads constantly now. Many look like real or informative things to follow or believe but they are junk. How to get to certain settings on the app is anyone‚Äôs guess. Also when you first open it now there is tremendous lag. I‚Äôve deleted it from my phone over and over but it runs very slow. And why there are so many profiles of people who have passed away is not right. I see family members suggested by Facebook that I follow‚Äî that have been dead for years. And yet I never even see the posts by people I‚Äôm currently friends with. Even if I make them a priority. Which leads me back to ads. Constant annoying ads. Which I suspect is slowing down the app in general.

title: iPad app doesn‚Äôt work as it should
text: I have more or less stopped using Facebook for iPad except here and there when I have to post something longer and want to use my iPad keyboard. Compared to the iPhone app, it is missing so many functions. Notification badges show up on the home screen but not in the app itself; it NEVER shows I have any notifications in the navigation bar at the bottom. The groups feed resets if you switch to another app for even a few seconds, so you can‚Äôt find whatever post you were just looking at. When viewing a post in a group, the banner pic never shows up on the right, just an endless spinning pinwheel. One cannot edit the navigation bar to include groups and exclude icons that are rarely used (friends, videos, marketplace). It‚Äôs not completely useless, but it‚Äôs ridiculously clunky, especially given that the iPhone app works so much better. It‚Äôs like the iPad app is the orphaned stepchild version.

title: TERRIBLE FOR BUSINESSES AND CREATORS
text: META won‚Äôt even allow a reach of a post that has a website link. I only use facebook business for business purposes but META wants you to pay for promotion. Even when you do you BARELY get results. They invited me to the reels program last year and IMMEDIATELY said they couldn‚Äôt pay me because my social was wrong.. SAME SOCIAL I USED SINCE 2005 on Facebook.. same social i used when i sold products through the marketplace for years. META is all about money .. and it‚Äôs a terrible platform if your trying to grow your business. ALSO.. i notice facebook removes metaphysical and psychic newage content from marketplace !! EVERY ITEM I POST GETS REMOVED .. because it‚Äôs of a spiritual nature !! So i no longer sell on the marketplace as a result. META.. y‚Äôall need to figure it out and stop being so clearly biased to businesses and NON religious content. I post a reel ( that you refuse to pay me for ) and it gets 1k views and i post my website on my business page (NO VIEWS AT ALL). It‚Äôs no wonder TIKTOK is beating you ‚Ä¶. as terrible of an app as it is!! people are able to monetize their business !!!!

title: Extremely Poor Development
text: It‚Äôs strange how Facebook, or ‚ÄúMeta‚Äù, whatever that is, constantly tries to make Facebook the forefront app in order to access other features of other apps. You can‚Äôt use an Oculus without a Facebook account, and on top of that you need Messenger to chat on it. For whatever reason on Instagram you need a Facebook account for the new ‚ÄúAccount Center‚Äù when accessing accounts that share different emails. Frankly, this was much simpler when you could access all your accounts through instagram itself through the different emails. Then in a new update, that was revoked and replaced with the Account Center. Please, stop trying to make Facebook seem more dire than it is. It‚Äôs even more difficult to make separate Facebook accounts with different then instagram accounts to match each of those. Frankly this is sad and very poor usage of such a large app. I‚Äôve never seen an app with so many users with such a low rating. But as long as the money is rolling in I doubt you all care about the ease of access you supply your consumers with.

title: Its all about collecting personal data
text: I just created a profile after months. I deleted my old account as I felt fb was into my life too much. Plus most of the suggestions were very segregated as I only had access to people who look like me despite the diversity in my personal life. I had my old account since 2015. Anyways, I created a profile just 20 minutes ago. I put a facebook cover up of my business like I‚Äôve always done in the past. Didn‚Äôt put a profile pic up yet as I wanted to put one up that was really liked. I modified some settings and decided I‚Äôll come back after a break to finish. Facebook sent me an e-mail 5 minutes after signing out saying my account was disabled for breaking community guidelines. There are so many ways to connect with people in the world without this platform. If I immediately posted all of my personal information I guarantee my profile would still be up and running. These big sell out companies show their true colors every time. I don‚Äôt take this personal and happy facebook did me a favor.

title: Would like for me to determine what is relevant
text: Facebook‚Äôs automatic filters and algorithms don‚Äôt allow for me to see stuff that I want to actually see without working harder than necessary. For example, I like reading all the comments and not seeing ‚Äúrelevant‚Äù comments because what is relevant to facebook isn‚Äôt relevant to me.  Sometimes, even after clicking all, it still shows only the ‚Äúrelevant‚Äù posts and says so in subthreads of the comments.  Why?  All comments should be all and my preference should be able to be set such that if I want your crappy version of relevant, then I select it as a setting.  In addition to that, there are posts from people that my wife and I are friends on and off facebook with that she can see their posts and I can‚Äôt due to something in my algorithm no matter how far I scroll without going to that person‚Äôs page.  Please get back to letting people determine their social media experience and off of you controlling it.  I actually give you 0 stars but apple won‚Äôt let me rate you that low for some unknown reason.

I dont want to use this platform anymore. You guys cannot be trusted. Its not just the ceo or the executive but the engineers, product managers, data Scientists, marketing, business dev. etc. that allow these things to happen, that build these feature and functionality and make partnerships to sell this. Why did the people who work at facebook think this was okay for all these massive breaches of privacy. You guys are consumers too, you set new standards for what is okay and can influence industries so dont say everyone else is doing it or privacy isnt going to be a thing anymore. If its not its because you had a massive part in taking it away.

Oh the title... i just keep Facebook because its a way for me to connect with so many friends. If i delete Facebook i lose them. Who knew using depending on a company for so many social aspects of my life would end up being some sick trap where i loose too much to drop immediately. I feel stuck with a company and dont know a good alternative, good job i guess this was your plan.

All I ask is to give me a chance to get...

title: Avatars feature has never worked
text: For some insane reason, I have never been able to get the Avatars feature to work for me. I have had 2 different phones and updated the app every time there is one available, and the link to go to it has never appeared under ‚ÄúSee More‚Äù in the menu. After this most recent phone upgrade, I did notice when other people post avatar stickers, I can click below it where it says ‚ÄúCreate Your Avatar‚Äù, but when I do so it says I don‚Äôt have the right version of the Facebook app to support the feature, and going to the App Store does nothing because it‚Äôs the latest version of the software. I have also deleted and redownloaded the app several times. Even going to the website through Safari on my phone and on a laptop I still can‚Äôt access it anywhere. I have reported the issue multiple times and never received a response from Facebook about it, I‚Äôm just completely confused as to why I am not able to create an Avatar whatsoever.

title: It just keeps getting worse
text:
Every time the developers fiddle with this app, some useful functionality disappears. Months ago, it was the link between the birthday notifications and the timeline of the honoree. I keep expecting this to be fixed, but clicking on the link that supposedly takes you to the page where you can convey good wishes still results in a broken link notice. What‚Äôll the point of telling you someone has a birthday if you have to go through all manner of gyrations to wish them a happy one? In native FB, this problem doesn‚Äôt occur, so it‚Äôs definitely in this app.

Now, I find that the little blue dot that indicates an unread notification no longer disappears when you click on the link to the notice, so that you quickly lose your place. Again, native FB doesn‚Äôt create this problem.

So, what‚Äôll the point of using this app at all? Why not just go in through your web browser?

title: Okay, but could be better
text: Overall, I enjoy my Facebook experience since I mostly just use it for keeping up with what my families up to. However, I do know that people can easily get hacked and never get there accounts back. I also know from my experience what I‚Äôm frustrated about. For a long time I would open my notifications on Facebook, and it would always asks for my location or to know my contacts. Personally, this is not something I feel I need to share with Facebook. To me it‚Äôs not necessary for the app to function with my information so I see no point in sharing that. To get to my point, it‚Äôd be a lot nicer if Facebook didn‚Äôt ask for my personal information when I‚Äôve clearly skewed I‚Äôm not going to give it. I do mostly love the app, but I wish it would stop being so annoying with its persistence to get information from a minor. I hope this helps!

title: Marketplace searching
text: Facebook is single handily creating the fastest way to destroy there user base.  Every time the app updates it might "fix" one thing but breaks another.  I am tired of there "fixes" apparently there is not testing department there anymore they use the public to test.  The marketplace searching now stopped working with the latest update.  Does not matter what I search for nothing shows up no matter how far out I look.  I can see the items and search for the title of the items I see still nothing.  The recent posts I want to see what happened with my friends since the last time I was on and that is a total joke.  It worked perfect then they "fixed" that also maybe so they could put more adds on my wall or something but either way all it is doing is driving there users away in droves.  I have started to follow my family and friends on other apps because so many of them have chosen other paths for there social media.  Facebook you had the keys to the kingdom but just as my space is gone so shall you if you don't start to listen to your reviews and users!

title: Censorship and suggested posts
text: In a free country, I should be able to post any post I want to for my own family and friends to read without Facebook butting its ugly head jn and saying it is a lie. Is Facebook doctors? Yet they censored posts about covid and Hunter Biden‚Äôs laptop. If I believe Hamas are animals for raping and killing people, who is Facebook to filter my posts to my own family?  Also every time I open my Facebook, every single day I see Taylor swift, Madonna, Michael Jackson or the karashians. I would rather slide down a razor blade than listen or see any of these people. Facebooks services have only gotten worse over the years. In terms of a business page, we have to pay Facebook so that our own followers can see our serves we offer.  More than half of our followers never see anything we post. Why even have followers if we have to pay for them to see our business?  Zuckerberg pays millions to interfere in the 2020 election and then goes and builds himself a bunker in Hawaii to hide like a coward when our nation is destroyed by Biden‚Äôs rotten government. You did this zuck.

title: Facebook creator review by Amanda Massengill
text: Facebook is really improving going into the 2024 year. I stopped creating on here for a while because of the features other platforms gave me to grow & do what I love. It seemed to becoming the thing of the past, but I‚Äôm really impressed by the changes & updates that they are giving us. Facebook has always felt like home to me. I tried to stick with them for a long time, until it was hurting my hard work $ dedication I put into my content. Now that they are upping their game & offering more to their creators experience & personal experience, I‚Äôm back! Thank you for caring enough to give us who always stood by you no matter goes much it hurt us, more opportunities that those of us who really work hard for you & ourselves. Also, for making personal use of Facebook more enjoyable.
